definition: to resolve a difficult situation and leave worries behind (idiom)
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: The above mentioned officials, who solve problems for both the country and the public, are excellent ones.
sentences.chinese: 上述爲國爲民排憂解難的官員就是優秀的。

sentences.english: Friends indeed can be friends in need after graduation.
sentences.chinese: 真正的朋友能夠在你畢業後會爲你排憂解難。

sentences.english: Establish record cards for clients, cl ients. carry out callback system inorder to duly resolve problems.

sentences.english: Voters judged Mr Romney most capable of easing their pain.
sentences.chinese: 選民們斷定羅姆內先生最具實力爲他們排憂解難。

sentences.english: In a word me the man-days with future hope system can can get typeset for people You untie disaster.

sentences.english: With good reputation this Housemaid Service Center is ready to do its best to solve your problems and allay your apprehensions.
sentences.chinese: 本保姆服務中心聲譽良好，願爲您家庭排憂解難盡力。
